welcome.name: Welcome
welcome.content: ## About discord.js is a powerful [Node.js](https://nodejs.org) module that allows you to easily interact with the [Discord API](https://discord.com/developers/docs/intro). - Object-oriented - Predictable abstractions - Performant - 100% coverage of the Discord API ## Installation **Node.js 14.0.0 or newer is required.** ```sh-session npm install discord.js ``` ### Optional packages - [zlib-sync](https://www.npmjs.com/package/zlib-sync) for WebSocket data compression and inflation (`npm install zlib-sync`) - [erlpack](https://github.com/discord/erlpack) for significantly faster WebSocket data (de)serialisation (`npm install discord/erlpack`) - [bufferutil](https://www.npmjs.com/package/bufferutil) for a much faster WebSocket connection (`npm install bufferutil`) - [utf-8-validate](https://www.npmjs.com/package/utf-8-validate) in combination with `bufferutil` for much faster WebSocket processing (`npm install utf-8-validate`) - [@discordjs/voice](https://github.com/discordjs/voice) for interacting with the Discord Voice API ## Example usage ```js const { Client, Intents } = require('discord.js'); const client = new Client({ intents: [Intents.FLAGS.GUILDS, Intents.FLAGS.GUILD_MESSAGES] }); client.on('ready', () => { console.log(`Logged in as ${client.user.tag}!`); }); client.on('message', message => { if (message.content === 'ping') { message.channel.send('pong'); } }); client.login('token'); ``` ## Links - [Website](https://discord.js.org/) ([source](https://github.com/discordjs/website)) - [Documentation](https://discord.js.org/#/docs/main/master/general/welcome) - [Guide](https://discordjs.guide/) ([source](https://github.com/discordjs/guide)) - this is still for stable See also the [Update Guide](https://discordjs.guide/additional-info/changes-in-v12.html), including updated and removed items in the library. - [Discord.js Discord server](https://discord.gg/djs) - [Discord API Discord server](https://discord.gg/discord-api) - [GitHub](https://github.com/discordjs/discord.js) - [NPM](https://www.npmjs.com/package/discord.js) - [Related libraries](https://discord.com/developers/docs/topics/community-resources#libraries) ### Extensions - [RPC](https://www.npmjs.com/package/discord-rpc) ([source](https://github.com/discordjs/RPC)) ## Contributing Before creating an issue, please ensure that it hasn't already been reported/suggested, and double-check the [documentation](https://discord.js.org/#/docs). See [the contribution guide](https://github.com/discordjs/discord.js/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md) if you'd like to submit a PR. ## Help If you don't understand something in the documentation, you are experiencing problems, or you just need a gentle nudge in the right direction, please don't hesitate to join our official [Discord.js Server](https://discord.gg/djs).

classes.name: Client
classes.description: The main hub for interacting with the Discord API, and the starting point for any bot.

props.name: ws
props.description: The WebSocket manager of the client

props.name: actions
props.description: The action manager of the client

props.name: voice
props.description: The voice manager of the client

props.name: shard
props.description: Shard helpers for the client (only if the process was spawned from a {@link ShardingManager})

props.name: users
props.description: All of the {@link User} objects that have been cached at any point, mapped by their IDs

props.name: guilds
props.description:
All of the guilds the client is currently handling, mapped by their IDs -
as long as sharding isn't being used, this will be *every* guild the bot is a member of

props.name: channels
props.description:
All of the {@link Channel}s that the client is currently handling, mapped by their IDs -
as long as sharding isn't being used, this will be *every* channel in *every* guild the bot
is a member of. Note that DM channels will not be initially cached, and thus not be present
in the Manager without their explicit fetching or use.

props.name: presence
props.description: The presence of the Client

props.name: token
props.description:
Authorization token for the logged in bot.
If present, this defaults to `process.env.DISCORD_TOKEN` when instantiating the client
<warn>This should be kept private at all times.</warn>

props.name: user
props.description: User that the client is logged in as

props.name: application
props.description: The application of this bot

props.name: readyAt
props.description:
Time at which the client was last regarded as being in the `READY` state
(each time the client disconnects and successfully reconnects, this will be overwritten)

props.name: emojis
props.description: All custom emojis that the client has access to, mapped by their IDs

props.name: readyTimestamp
props.description: Timestamp of the time the client was last `READY` at

props.name: uptime
props.description: How long it has been since the client last entered the `READY` state in milliseconds

props.name: _timeouts
props.description: Timeouts set by {@link BaseClient#setTimeout} that are still active

props.name: _intervals
props.description: Intervals set by {@link BaseClient#setInterval} that are still active

props.name: _immediates
props.description: Intervals set by {@link BaseClient#setImmediate} that are still active

props.name: options
props.description: The options the client was instantiated with

props.name: rest
props.description: The REST manager of the client

props.name: api
props.description: API shortcut

methods.name: login
methods.description: Logs the client in, establishing a websocket connection to Discord.
examples: client.login('my token');

params.name: token
params.description: Token of the account to log in with

returns.description: Token of the account used

methods.name: destroy
methods.description: Logs out, terminates the connection to Discord, and destroys the client.

methods.name: fetchInvite
methods.description: Obtains an invite from Discord.

methods.name: fetchGuildTemplate
methods.description: Obtains a template from Discord.

methods.name: fetchWebhook
methods.description: Obtains a webhook from Discord.

methods.name: fetchVoiceRegions
methods.description: Obtains the available voice regions from Discord.

methods.name: sweepMessages
methods.description:
Sweeps all text-based channels' messages and removes the ones older than the max message lifetime.
If the message has been edited, the time of the edit is used rather than the time of the original message.

params.name: lifetime
params.description:
Messages that are older than this (in seconds)
will be removed from the caches. The default is based on {@link ClientOptions#messageCacheLifetime}

returns.description:
Amount of messages that were removed from the caches,
or -1 if the message cache lifetime is unlimited

methods.name: fetchGuildPreview
methods.description: Obtains a guild preview from Discord, available for all guilds the bot is in and all Discoverable guilds.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild to fetch the preview for

methods.name: fetchWidget
methods.description: Obtains the widget of a guild from Discord, available for guilds with the widget enabled.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild to fetch the widget for

methods.name: generateInvite
methods.description: Generates a link that can be used to invite the bot to a guild.

Calls {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/eval} on a script
with the client as `this`.

events.name: channelCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild channel is created.

events.name: channelDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a channel is deleted.

events.name: guildBanAdd
events.description: Emitted whenever a member is banned from a guild.

events.name: guildBanRemove
events.description: Emitted whenever a member is unbanned from a guild.

events.name: guildUnavailable
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild becomes unavailable, likely due to a server outage.

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild that has become unavailable

events.name: guildDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild kicks the client or the guild is deleted/left.

events.name: emojiCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever a custom emoji is created in a guild.

events.name: emojiDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a custom emoji is deleted in a guild.

events.name: emojiUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a custom emoji is updated in a guild.

events.name: guildIntegrationsUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild integration is updated

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild whose integrations were updated

events.name: guildMemberRemove
events.description: Emitted whenever a member leaves a guild, or is kicked.

params.name: member
params.description: The member that has left/been kicked from the guild

events.name: guildMemberUpdate
events.description:
Emitted whenever a guild member changes - i.e. new role, removed role, nickname.
Also emitted when the user's details (e.g. username) change.

events.name: guildMemberAvailable
events.description: Emitted whenever a member becomes available in a large guild.

events.name: roleCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever a role is created.

events.name: roleDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild role is deleted.

events.name: roleUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild role is updated.

events.name: guildUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild is updated - e.g. name change.

events.name: interaction
events.description: Emitted when an interaction is created.

events.name: inviteCreate
events.description:
Emitted when an invite is created.
<info> This event only triggers if the client has `MANAGE_GUILD` permissions for the guild,
or `MANAGE_CHANNEL` permissions for the channel.</info>

events.name: inviteDelete
events.description:
Emitted when an invite is deleted.
<info> This event only triggers if the client has `MANAGE_GUILD` permissions for the guild,
or `MANAGE_CHANNEL` permissions for the channel.</info>

events.name: message
events.description: Emitted whenever a message is created.

events.name: messageDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a message is deleted.

events.name: messageDeleteBulk
events.description: Emitted whenever messages are deleted in bulk.

params.name: messages
params.description: The deleted messages, mapped by their ID

events.name: messageReactionAdd
events.description: Emitted whenever a reaction is added to a cached message.

params.name: user
params.description: The user that applied the guild or reaction emoji

events.name: messageReactionRemove
events.description: Emitted whenever a reaction is removed from a cached message.

params.name: user
params.description: The user whose emoji or reaction emoji was removed

events.name: messageReactionRemoveAll
events.description: Emitted whenever all reactions are removed from a cached message.

params.name: message
params.description: The message the reactions were removed from

events.name: messageReactionRemoveEmoji
events.description: Emitted when a bot removes an emoji reaction from a cached message.

events.name: presenceUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild member's presence (e.g. status, activity) is changed.

params.name: oldPresence
params.description: The presence before the update, if one at all

events.name: stageInstanceCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever a stage instance is created.

events.name: stageInstanceDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a stage instance is deleted.

events.name: stageInstanceUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a stage instance gets updated - e.g. change in topic or privacy level

params.name: oldStageInstance
params.description: The stage instance before the update

params.name: newStageInstance
params.description: The stage instance after the update

events.name: threadCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever a thread is created or when the client user is added to a thread.

events.name: threadDelete
events.description: Emitted whenever a thread is deleted.

events.name: threadListSync
events.description: Emitted whenever the client user gains access to a text or news channel that contains threads

events.name: threadMembersUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever members are added or removed from a thread. Requires `GUILD_MEMBERS` privileged intent

events.name: threadMemberUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever the client user's thread member is updated.

events.name: typingStart
events.description: Emitted whenever a user starts typing in a channel.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel the user started typing in

events.name: userUpdate
events.description:
Emitted whenever a user's details (e.g. username) are changed.
Triggered by the Discord gateway events USER_UPDATE, GUILD_MEMBER_UPDATE, and PRESENCE_UPDATE.

events.name: voiceStateUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a member changes voice state - e.g. joins/leaves a channel, mutes/unmutes.

params.name: oldState
params.description: The voice state before the update

params.name: newState
params.description: The voice state after the update

events.name: webhookUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild text channel has its webhooks changed.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel that had a webhook update

events.name: warn
events.description: Emitted for general warnings.

events.name: debug
events.description: Emitted for general debugging information.

events.name: applicationCommandCreate
events.description: Emitted when an application command is created.

events.name: applicationCommandDelete
events.description: Emitted when an application command is deleted.

events.name: applicationCommandUpdate
events.description: Emitted when an application command is updated.

events.name: channelPinsUpdate
events.description:
Emitted whenever the pins of a channel are updated. Due to the nature of the WebSocket event,
not much information can be provided easily here - you need to manually check the pins yourself.

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel that the pins update occurred in

params.name: time
params.description: The time of the pins update

events.name: channelUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a channel is updated - e.g. name change, topic change, channel type change.

events.name: guildCreate
events.description: Emitted whenever the client joins a guild.

events.name: guildMemberAdd
events.description: Emitted whenever a user joins a guild.

params.name: member
params.description: The member that has joined a guild

events.name: guildMembersChunk
events.description: Emitted whenever a chunk of guild members is received (all members come from the same guild).

params.name: guild
params.description: The guild related to the member chunk

params.name: chunk.count
params.description: Number of chunks the client should receive

events.name: messageUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a message is updated - e.g. embed or content change.

events.name: shardResume
events.description: Emitted when a shard resumes successfully.

events.name: threadUpdate
events.description: Emitted whenever a thread is updated - e.g. name change, archive state change, locked state change.

events.name: shardReady
events.description: Emitted when a shard turns ready.

params.name: id
params.description: The shard ID that turned ready

params.name: unavailableGuilds
params.description: Set of unavailable guild IDs, if any

events.name: shardDisconnect
events.description: Emitted when a shard's WebSocket disconnects and will no longer reconnect.

events.name: shardReconnecting
events.description: Emitted when a shard is attempting to reconnect or re-identify.

params.name: id
params.description: The shard ID that is attempting to reconnect

events.name: invalidated
events.description:
Emitted when the client's session becomes invalidated.
You are expected to handle closing the process gracefully and preventing a boot loop
if you are listening to this event.

events.name: ready
events.description: Emitted when the client becomes ready to start working.

events.name: shardError
events.description: Emitted whenever a shard's WebSocket encounters a connection error.

params.name: shardID
params.description: The shard that encountered this error

events.name: rateLimit
events.description: Emitted when the client hits a rate limit while making a request

params.name: rateLimitData
params.description: Object containing the rate limit info

events.name: invalidRequestWarning
events.description:
Emitted periodically when the process sends invalid requests to let users avoid the
10k invalid requests in 10 minutes threshold that causes a ban

params.name: invalidRequestWarningData
params.description: Object containing the invalid request info

events.name: error
events.description: Emitted when the client encounters an error.

classes.name: WebSocketManager
classes.description:
The WebSocket manager for this client.
<info>This class forwards raw dispatch events,
read more about it here {@link https://discord.com/developers/docs/topics/gateway}</info>

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated this WebSocketManager

props.name: gateway
props.description: The gateway this manager uses

props.name: totalShards
props.description: The amount of shards this manager handles

props.name: shards
props.description: A collection of all shards this manager handles

props.name: shardQueue
props.description: An array of shards to be connected or that need to reconnect

props.name: packetQueue
props.description: An array of queued events before this WebSocketManager became ready

props.name: status
props.description: The current status of this WebSocketManager

props.name: destroyed
props.description: If this manager was destroyed. It will prevent shards from reconnecting

props.name: reconnecting
props.description: If this manager is currently reconnecting one or multiple shards

props.name: ping
props.description: The average ping of all WebSocketShards

methods.name: debug
methods.description: Emits a debug message.

params.name: shard
params.description: The shard that emitted this message, if any

methods.name: connect
methods.description: Connects this manager to the gateway.

methods.name: createShards
methods.description: Handles the creation of a shard.

methods.name: reconnect
methods.description: Handles reconnects for this manager.

methods.name: broadcast
methods.description: Broadcasts a packet to every shard this manager handles.

methods.name: destroy
methods.description: Destroys this manager and all its shards.

methods.name: handlePacket
methods.description: Processes a packet and queues it if this WebSocketManager is not ready.

params.name: shard
params.description: The shard that will handle this packet

methods.name: checkShardsReady
methods.description: Checks whether the client is ready to be marked as ready.

methods.name: triggerClientReady
methods.description: Causes the client to be marked as ready and emits the ready event.

classes.name: WebSocketShard
classes.description: Represents a Shard's WebSocket connection

props.name: manager
props.description: The WebSocketManager of the shard

props.name: id
props.description: The ID of the shard

props.name: status
props.description: The current status of the shard

props.name: sequence
props.description: The current sequence of the shard

props.name: closeSequence
props.description: The sequence of the shard after close

props.name: sessionID
props.description: The current session ID of the shard

props.name: ping
props.description: The previous heartbeat ping of the shard

props.name: lastPingTimestamp
props.description: The last time a ping was sent (a timestamp)

props.name: lastHeartbeatAcked
props.description: If we received a heartbeat ack back. Used to identify zombie connections

props.name: ratelimit
props.description: Contains the rate limit queue and metadata

props.name: connection
props.description: The WebSocket connection for the current shard

props.name: inflate
props.description: The compression to use

props.name: helloTimeout
props.description: The HELLO timeout

props.name: eventsAttached
props.description: If the manager attached its event handlers on the shard

props.name: expectedGuilds
props.description: A set of guild IDs this shard expects to receive

props.name: readyTimeout
props.description: The ready timeout

props.name: connectedAt
props.description: Time when the WebSocket connection was opened

methods.name: debug
methods.description: Emits a debug event.

methods.name: connect
methods.description: Connects the shard to the gateway.

returns.description:
A promise that will resolve if the shard turns ready successfully,
or reject if we couldn't connect

methods.name: onOpen
methods.description: Called whenever a connection is opened to the gateway.

methods.name: onMessage
methods.description: Called whenever a message is received.

methods.name: onError
methods.description: Called whenever an error occurs with the WebSocket.

methods.name: onClose
methods.description: Called whenever a connection to the gateway is closed.

methods.name: onPacket
methods.description: Called whenever a packet is received.

methods.name: checkReady
methods.description: Checks if the shard can be marked as ready

methods.name: setHelloTimeout
methods.description: Sets the HELLO packet timeout.

params.name: time
params.description: If set to -1, it will clear the hello timeout timeout

methods.name: setHeartbeatTimer
methods.description: Sets the heartbeat timer for this shard.

params.name: time
params.description: If -1, clears the interval, any other number sets an interval

methods.name: sendHeartbeat
methods.description:
Sends a heartbeat to the WebSocket.
If this shard didn't receive a heartbeat last time, it will destroy it and reconnect

params.name: tag
params.description: What caused this heartbeat to be sent

params.name: ignoreHeartbeatAck
params.description: If we should send the heartbeat forcefully.

methods.name: ackHeartbeat
methods.description: Acknowledges a heartbeat.

methods.name: identify
methods.description: Identifies the client on the connection.

methods.name: identifyNew
methods.description: Identifies as a new connection on the gateway.

methods.name: identifyResume
methods.description: Resumes a session on the gateway.

methods.name: send
methods.description:
Adds a packet to the queue to be sent to the gateway.
<warn>If you use this method, make sure you understand that you need to provide
a full [Payload](https://discord.com/developers/docs/topics/gateway#commands-and-events-gateway-commands).
Do not use this method if you don't know what you're doing.</warn>

params.name: important
params.description: If this packet should be added first in queue

methods.name: _send
methods.description: Sends data, bypassing the queue.

methods.name: processQueue
methods.description: Processes the current WebSocket queue.

methods.name: destroy
methods.description: Destroys this shard and closes its WebSocket connection.

params.name: options
params.default: { closeCode: 1000, reset: false, emit: true, log: true }

methods.name: _cleanupConnection
methods.description: Cleans up the WebSocket connection listeners.

methods.name: _emitDestroyed
methods.description: Emits the DESTROYED event on the shard

events.name: close
events.description: Emitted when a shard's WebSocket closes.

events.name: ready
events.description: Emitted when the shard receives the READY payload and is now waiting for guilds

events.name: resumed
events.description: Emitted when the shard resumes successfully

events.name: allReady
events.description:
Emitted when the shard is fully ready.
This event is emitted if:
* all guilds were received by this shard
* the ready timeout expired, and some guilds are unavailable

params.name: unavailableGuilds
params.description: Set of unavailable guilds, if any

events.name: destroyed
events.description: Emitted when a shard is destroyed, but no WebSocket connection was present.

props.name: cache

methods.description: Resolves a GuildMemberResolvable to a member ID string.

params.description: The user that is part of the guild

methods.name: fetch
methods.description: Fetches member(s) from Discord, even if they're offline.
examples:
// Fetch a single member without checking cache
guild.members.fetch({ user, force: true })
  .then(console.log)
  .catch(console.error)

params.name: options
params.description:
If a UserResolvable, the user to fetch.
If undefined, fetches all members.
If a query, it limits the results to users with similar usernames.

methods.name: search
methods.description: Searches for members in the guild based on a query.

methods.name: edit
methods.description:
Edits a member of the guild.
<info>The user must be a member of the guild</info>

params.name: data
params.description: The data to edit the member with

methods.name: prune
methods.description:
Prunes members from the guild based on how long they have been inactive.
<info>It's recommended to set `options.count` to `false` for large guilds.</info>

returns.description: The number of members that were/will be kicked

methods.name: kick
methods.description:
Kicks a user from the guild.
<info>The user must be a member of the guild</info>

returns.description:
Result object will be resolved as specifically as possible.
If the GuildMember cannot be resolved, the User will instead be attempted to be resolved. If that also cannot
be resolved, the user ID will be the result.

methods.name: ban
methods.description: Bans a user from the guild.

returns.description:
Result object will be resolved as specifically as possible.
If the GuildMember cannot be resolved, the User will instead be attempted to be resolved. If that also cannot
be resolved, the user ID will be the result.
Internally calls the GuildBanManager#create method.

methods.name: unban
methods.description: Unbans a user from the guild.

returns.description: Internally calls the GuildBanManager#remove method.

classes.name: Shard
classes.description:
A self-contained shard created by the {@link ShardingManager}. Each one has a {@link ChildProcess} that contains
an instance of the bot and its {@link Client}. When its child process/worker exits for any reason, the shard will
spawn a new one to replace it as necessary.

params.name: manager
params.description: Manager that is creating this shard

props.name: manager
props.description: Manager that created the shard

props.name: id
props.description: ID of the shard in the manager

props.name: args
props.description: Arguments for the shard's process (only when {@link ShardingManager#mode} is `process`)

props.name: execArgv
props.description: Arguments for the shard's process executable (only when {@link ShardingManager#mode} is `process`)

props.name: env
props.description: Environment variables for the shard's process, or workerData for the shard's worker

props.name: ready
props.description: Whether the shard's {@link Client} is ready

props.name: process
props.description: Process of the shard (if {@link ShardingManager#mode} is `process`)

props.name: worker
props.description: Worker of the shard (if {@link ShardingManager#mode} is `worker`)

props.name: _evals
props.description: Ongoing promises for calls to {@link Shard#eval}, mapped by the `script` they were called with

props.name: _fetches
props.description: Ongoing promises for calls to {@link Shard#fetchClientValue}, mapped by the `prop` they were called with

props.name: _exitListener
props.description: Listener function for the {@link ChildProcess}' `exit` event

methods.name: spawn
methods.description:
Forks a child process or creates a worker thread for the shard.
<warn>You should not need to call this manually.</warn>

params.name: timeout
params.description:
The amount in milliseconds to wait until the {@link Client} has become ready
before resolving (`-1` or `Infinity` for no wait)

methods.name: kill
methods.description: Immediately kills the shard's process/worker and does not restart it.

methods.name: respawn
methods.description: Kills and restarts the shard's process/worker.

methods.name: send
methods.description: Sends a message to the shard's process/worker.

params.name: message
params.description: Message to send to the shard

methods.name: fetchClientValue
methods.description: Fetches a client property value of the shard.

params.name: prop
params.description: Name of the client property to get, using periods for nesting

methods.name: eval
methods.description: Evaluates a script or function on the shard, in the context of the {@link Client}.

params.name: script
params.description: JavaScript to run on the shard

returns.description: Result of the script execution

methods.name: _handleMessage
methods.description: Handles a message received from the child process/worker.

methods.name: _handleExit
methods.description: Handles the shard's process/worker exiting.

params.name: respawn
params.description: Whether to spawn the shard again

events.name: spawn
events.description: Emitted upon the creation of the shard's child process/worker.

events.name: ready
events.description: Emitted upon the shard's {@link Client#ready} event.

events.name: disconnect
events.description: Emitted upon the shard's {@link Client#disconnect} event.

events.name: reconnecting
events.description: Emitted upon the shard's {@link Client#reconnecting} event.

events.name: message
events.description: Emitted upon receiving a message from the child process/worker.

events.name: death
events.description: Emitted upon the shard's child process/worker exiting.

classes.name: ShardingManager
classes.description:
This is a utility class that makes multi-process sharding of a bot an easy and painless experience.
It works by spawning a self-contained {@link ChildProcess} or {@link Worker} for each individual shard, each
containing its own instance of your bot's {@link Client}. They all have a line of communication with the master
process, and there are several useful methods that utilise it in order to simplify tasks that are normally difficult
with sharding. It can spawn a specific number of shards or the amount that Discord suggests for the bot, and takes a
path to your main bot script to launch for each one.

params.name: file
params.description: Path to your shard script file

props.name: file
props.description: Path to the shard script file

props.name: shardList
props.description: List of shards this sharding manager spawns

props.name: totalShards
props.description: Amount of shards that all sharding managers spawn in total

props.name: mode
props.description: Mode for shards to spawn with

props.name: respawn
props.description: Whether shards should automatically respawn upon exiting

props.name: shardArgs
props.description: An array of arguments to pass to shards (only when {@link ShardingManager#mode} is `process`)

props.name: execArgv
props.description: An array of arguments to pass to the executable (only when {@link ShardingManager#mode} is `process`)

props.name: token
props.description: Token to use for obtaining the automatic shard count, and passing to shards

props.name: shards
props.description: A collection of shards that this manager has spawned

methods.name: createShard
methods.description:
Creates a single shard.
<warn>Using this method is usually not necessary if you use the spawn method.</warn>

params.name: id
params.description:
ID of the shard to create
<info>This is usually not necessary to manually specify.</info>

returns.description: Note that the created shard needs to be explicitly spawned using its spawn method.

methods.name: spawn
methods.description: Spawns multiple shards.

methods.name: broadcast
methods.description: Sends a message to all shards.

params.name: message
params.description: Message to be sent to the shards

methods.name: broadcastEval
methods.description: Evaluates a script on all shards, or a given shard, in the context of the {@link Client}s.

params.name: script
params.description: JavaScript to run on each shard

returns.description: Results of the script execution

methods.name: fetchClientValues
methods.description: Fetches a client property value of each shard, or a given shard.

params.name: prop
params.description: Name of the client property to get, using periods for nesting

params.name: shard
params.description: Shard to fetch property from, all if undefined

methods.name: _performOnShards
methods.description: Runs a method with given arguments on all shards, or a given shard.

params.name: method
params.description: Method name to run on each shard

params.name: args
params.description: Arguments to pass through to the method call

params.name: shard
params.description: Shard to run on, all if undefined

returns.description: Results of the method execution

methods.name: respawnAll
methods.description: Kills all running shards and respawns them.

methods.description: Starts a typing indicator in the channel.
examples:
// Start typing in a channel, or increase the typing count by one
channel.startTyping();

// Start typing in a channel with a typing count of five, or set it to five
channel.startTyping(5);

params.description: The number of times startTyping should be considered to have been called

returns.description: Resolves once the bot stops typing gracefully, or rejects when an error occurs

methods.name: stopTyping
methods.description:
Stops the typing indicator in the channel.
The indicator will only stop if this is called as many times as startTyping().
<info>It can take a few seconds for the client user to stop typing.</info>
examples:
// Reduce the typing count by one and stop typing if it reached 0
channel.stopTyping();

// Force typing to fully stop regardless of typing count
channel.stopTyping(true);

params.description: Whether or not to reset the call count and force the indicator to stop

* `news` - a guild news channel
* `store` - a guild store channel

params.description: Options to send to the collector

methods.description:
Similar to createReactionCollector but in promise form.
Resolves with a collection of reactions that pass the specified filter.

params.description: Optional options to pass to the internal collector

methods.name: createMessageComponentInteractionCollector
methods.description: Creates a message component interaction collector.

params.name: options
params.description: Options to send to the collector

methods.name: awaitMessageComponentInteraction
methods.description:
Collects a single component interaction that passes the filter.
The Promise will reject if the time expires.

params.name: options
params.description: Options to pass to the internal collector

methods.name: fetchReference
methods.description: Fetches the Message this crosspost/reply/pin-add references, if available to the client

methods.name: edit
methods.description: Edits the content of the message.

methods.name: crosspost
methods.description: Publishes a message in an announcement channel to all channels following it.

methods.name: pin
methods.description: Pins this message to the channel's pinned messages.
examples:
// Pin a message
message.pin()
  .then(console.log)
  .catch(console.error)

methods.name: unpin
methods.description: Unpins this message from the channel's pinned messages.
examples:
// Unpin a message
message.unpin()
  .then(console.log)
  .catch(console.error)

methods.name: react
methods.description: Adds a reaction to the message.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes the message.

methods.name: reply
methods.description: Send an inline reply to this message.

methods.name: startThread
methods.description: Create a new public thread from this message

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the new Thread

params.name: autoArchiveDuration
params.description: How long before the thread is automatically archived

methods.name: fetch
methods.description: Fetch this message.

params.name: force
params.description: Whether to skip the cache check and request the API

methods.name: fetchWebhook
methods.description: Fetches the webhook used to create this message.

methods.name: suppressEmbeds
methods.description: Suppresses or unsuppresses embeds on a message.

params.name: suppress
params.description: If the embeds should be suppressed or not

methods.name: removeAttachments
methods.description: Removes the attachments from this message.

methods.name: equals
methods.description:
Used mainly internally. Whether two messages are identical in properties. If you want to compare messages
without checking all the properties, use `message.id === message2.id`, which is much more efficient. This
method allows you to see if there are differences in content, embeds, attachments, nonce and tts properties.

params.name: message
params.description: The message to compare it to

params.name: rawData
params.description: Raw data passed through the WebSocket about this message

methods.name: toString
methods.description: When concatenated with a string, this automatically concatenates the message's content instead of the object.
examples:
// Logs: Message: This is a message!
console.log(`Message: ${message}`);

methods.description: Starts a typing indicator in the channel.
examples:
// Start typing in a channel, or increase the typing count by one
channel.startTyping();

// Start typing in a channel with a typing count of five, or set it to five
channel.startTyping(5);

params.name: count
params.description: The number of times startTyping should be considered to have been called

returns.description: Resolves once the bot stops typing gracefully, or rejects when an error occurs

methods.name: stopTyping
methods.description:
Stops the typing indicator in the channel.
The indicator will only stop if this is called as many times as startTyping().
<info>It can take a few seconds for the client user to stop typing.</info>
examples:
// Reduce the typing count by one and stop typing if it reached 0
channel.stopTyping();

// Force typing to fully stop regardless of typing count
channel.stopTyping(true);

params.description: Whether or not to reset the call count and force the indicator to stop

classes.name: ReactionCollector
classes.description:
Collects reactions on messages.
Will automatically stop if the message (`'messageDelete'`),
channel (`'channelDelete'`), or guild (`'guildDelete'`) are deleted.

params.name: message
params.description: The message upon which to collect reactions

params.name: options
params.description: The options to apply to this collector

props.name: message
props.description: The message upon which to collect reactions

props.name: users
props.description: The users which have reacted to this message

props.name: total
props.description: The total number of reactions collected

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated this Collector

props.name: filter
props.description: The filter applied to this collector

props.name: options
props.description: The options of this collector

props.name: collected
props.description: The items collected by this collector

props.name: ended
props.description: Whether this collector has finished collecting

props.name: _timeout
props.description: Timeout for cleanup

props.name: _idletimeout
props.description: Timeout for cleanup due to inactivity

props.name: next
props.description:
Returns a promise that resolves with the next collected element;
rejects with collected elements if the collector finishes without receiving a next element

methods.name: collect
methods.description: Handles an incoming reaction for possible collection.

params.name: user
params.description: The user that added the reaction

methods.name: dispose
methods.description: Handles a reaction deletion for possible disposal.

params.name: reaction
params.description: The reaction to possibly dispose of

params.name: user
params.description: The user that removed the reaction

methods.name: empty
methods.description: Empties this reaction collector.

methods.name: _handleMessageDeletion
methods.description: Handles checking if the message has been deleted, and if so, stops the collector with the reason 'messageDelete'.

methods.name: _handleChannelDeletion
methods.description: Handles checking if the channel has been deleted, and if so, stops the collector with the reason 'channelDelete'.

methods.name: _handleGuildDeletion
methods.description: Handles checking if the guild has been deleted, and if so, stops the collector with the reason 'guildDelete'.

methods.name: handleCollect
methods.description: Call this to handle an event as a collectable element. Accepts any event data as parameters.

params.name: args
params.description: The arguments emitted by the listener

methods.name: handleDispose
methods.description: Call this to remove an element from the collection. Accepts any event data as parameters.

params.name: args
params.description: The arguments emitted by the listener

methods.name: stop
methods.description: Stops this collector and emits the `end` event.

params.name: reason
params.description: The reason this collector is ending

methods.name: resetTimer
methods.description: Resets the collector's timeout and idle timer.

methods.name: checkEnd
methods.description: Checks whether the collector should end, and if so, ends it.

methods.name: key
methods.description: Gets the collector key for a reaction.

params.name: reaction
params.description: The message reaction to get the key for

events.name: collect
events.description: Emitted whenever a reaction is collected.

params.name: user
params.description: The user that added the reaction

events.name: create
events.description:
Emitted whenever a reaction is newly created on a message. Will emit only when a new reaction is
added to the message, as opposed to {@link Collector#collect} which which will
be emitted even when a reaction has already been added to the message.

params.name: user
params.description: The user that added the reaction

events.name: dispose
events.description: Emitted when the reaction had all the users removed and the `dispose` option is set to true.

params.name: reaction
params.description: The reaction that was disposed of

params.name: user
params.description: The user that removed the reaction

events.name: remove
events.description: Emitted when the reaction had one user removed and the `dispose` option is set to true.

params.name: user
params.description: The user that removed the reaction

events.name: end
events.description: Emitted when the collector is finished collecting.

params.name: collected
params.description: The elements collected by the collector

classes.name: ReactionEmoji
classes.description:
Represents a limited emoji set used for both custom and unicode emojis. Custom emojis
will use this class opposed to the Emoji class when the client doesn't know enough
information about them.

props.name: reaction
props.description: The message reaction this emoji refers to

props.name: animated
props.description: Whether this emoji is animated

props.name: name
props.description: The name of this emoji

props.name: id
props.description: The ID of this emoji

props.name: deleted
props.description: Whether this emoji has been deleted

props.name: identifier
props.description: The identifier of this emoji, used for message reactions

props.name: url
props.description: The URL to the emoji file if its a custom emoji

props.name: createdTimestamp
props.description: The timestamp the emoji was created at, or null if unicode

props.name: createdAt
props.description: The time the emoji was created at, or null if unicode

props.name: client
props.description: The client that instantiated this

methods.name: toString
methods.description:
When concatenated with a string, this automatically returns the text required to form a graphical emoji on Discord
instead of the Emoji object.
examples:
// Send the emoji used in a reaction to the channel the reaction is part of
reaction.message.channel.send(`The emoji used was: ${reaction.emoji}`);

methods.description:
Whether this role equals another role. It compares all properties, so for most operations

The type of the channel, either:
* `dm` - a DM channel
* `text` - a guild text channel
* `voice` - a guild voice channel
* `category` - a guild category channel
* `news` - a guild news channel
* `store` - a guild store channel
* `news_thread` - a guild news channel's public thread channel
* `public_thread` - a guild text channel's public thread channel
* `private_thread` - a guild text channel's private thread channel
* `stage` - a guild stage channel
* `unknown` - a generic channel of unknown type, could be Channel or GuildChannel

params.name: region

methods.name: startTyping
methods.description: Starts a typing indicator in the channel.
examples:
// Start typing in a channel, or increase the typing count by one
channel.startTyping();

// Start typing in a channel with a typing count of five, or set it to five
channel.startTyping(5);

params.name: count
params.description: The number of times startTyping should be considered to have been called

returns.description: Resolves once the bot stops typing gracefully, or rejects when an error occurs

methods.name: stopTyping
methods.description:
Stops the typing indicator in the channel.
The indicator will only stop if this is called as many times as startTyping().
<info>It can take a few seconds for the client user to stop typing.</info>
examples:
// Reduce the typing count by one and stop typing if it reached 0
channel.stopTyping();

// Force typing to fully stop regardless of typing count
channel.stopTyping(true);

params.name: force
params.description: Whether or not to reset the call count and force the indicator to stop

methods.name: setRequestToSpeak
methods.description:
Toggles the request to speak in the channel.
Only applicable for stage channels and for the client's own voice state.
examples:
// Making the client request to speak in a stage channel (raise its hand)
guild.me.voice.setRequestToSpeak(true);

// Making the client cancel a request to speak
guild.me.voice.setRequestToSpeak(false);

params.name: request
params.description: Whether or not the client is requesting to become a speaker.

methods.name: setSuppressed
methods.description: Suppress/unsuppress the user. Only applicable for stage channels.
examples:
// Making the client a speaker
guild.me.voice.setSuppressed(false);

// Making the client an audience member
guild.me.voice.setSuppressed(true);

// Inviting another user to speak
voiceState.setSuppressed(false);

// Moving another user to the audience, or cancelling their invite to speak
voiceState.setSuppressed(true);

params.name: suppressed
params.description: Whether or not the user should be suppressed.

classes.name: Permissions
classes.description:
Data structure that makes it easy to interact with a permission bitfield. All {@link GuildMember}s have a set of
permissions in their guild, and each channel in the guild may also have {@link PermissionOverwrites} for the member
that override their default permissions.

props.name: bitfield
props.description: Bitfield of the packed bits

props.name: FLAGS
props.description:
Numeric permission flags. All available properties:
* `ADMINISTRATOR` (implicitly has *all* permissions, and bypasses all channel overwrites)
* `CREATE_INSTANT_INVITE` (create invitations to the guild)
* `KICK_MEMBERS`
* `BAN_MEMBERS`
* `MANAGE_CHANNELS` (edit and reorder channels)
* `MANAGE_GUILD` (edit the guild information, region, etc.)
* `ADD_REACTIONS` (add new reactions to messages)
* `VIEW_AUDIT_LOG`
* `PRIORITY_SPEAKER`
* `STREAM`
* `VIEW_CHANNEL`
* `SEND_MESSAGES`
* `SEND_TTS_MESSAGES`
* `MANAGE_MESSAGES` (delete messages and reactions)
* `EMBED_LINKS` (links posted will have a preview embedded)
* `ATTACH_FILES`
* `READ_MESSAGE_HISTORY` (view messages that were posted prior to opening Discord)
* `MENTION_EVERYONE`
* `USE_EXTERNAL_EMOJIS` (use emojis from different guilds)
* `VIEW_GUILD_INSIGHTS`
* `CONNECT` (connect to a voice channel)
* `SPEAK` (speak in a voice channel)
* `MUTE_MEMBERS` (mute members across all voice channels)
* `DEAFEN_MEMBERS` (deafen members across all voice channels)
* `MOVE_MEMBERS` (move members between voice channels)
* `USE_VAD` (use voice activity detection)
* `CHANGE_NICKNAME`
* `MANAGE_NICKNAMES` (change other members' nicknames)
* `MANAGE_ROLES`
* `MANAGE_WEBHOOKS`
* `MANAGE_EMOJIS`
* `USE_APPLICATION_COMMANDS`
* `REQUEST_TO_SPEAK`
* `MANAGE_THREADS`
* `USE_PUBLIC_THREADS`
* `USE_PRIVATE_THREADS`

props.name: ALL
props.description: Bitfield representing every permission combined

props.name: DEFAULT
props.description: Bitfield representing the default permissions for users

props.name: STAGE_MODERATOR
props.description: Bitfield representing the permissions required for moderators of stage channels

props.name: EPOCH
props.description: Discord's epoch value (2015-01-01T00:00:00.000Z).

methods.name: generate
methods.description:
Generates a Discord snowflake.
<info>This hardcodes the worker ID as 1 and the process ID as 0.</info>

params.name: timestamp
params.description: Timestamp or date of the snowflake to generate

returns.description: The generated snowflake

methods.name: deconstruct
methods.description: Deconstructs a Discord snowflake.

returns.description: Deconstructed snowflake

classes.name: Structures
classes.description: Allows for the extension of built-in Discord.js structures that are instantiated by {@link BaseManager Managers}.

methods.name: get
methods.description: Retrieves a structure class.

params.name: structure
params.description: Name of the structure to retrieve

methods.name: extend
methods.description:
Extends a structure.
<warn> Make sure to extend all structures before instantiating your client.
Extending after doing so may not work as expected. </warn>

params.name: structure
params.description: Name of the structure class to extend

params.name: extender
params.description:
Function that takes the base class to extend as its only parameter and returns the
extended class/prototype

returns.description: Extended class/prototype returned from the extender

classes.name: SystemChannelFlags
classes.description:
Data structure that makes it easy to interact with a {@link Guild#systemChannelFlags} bitfield.
<info>Note that all event message types are enabled by default,
and by setting their corresponding flags you are disabling them</info>

props.name: bitfield
props.description: Bitfield of the packed bits

props.name: FLAGS
props.description:
Numeric system channel flags. All available properties:
* `SUPPRESS_JOIN_NOTIFICATIONS` (Suppress member join notifications)
* `SUPPRESS_PREMIUM_SUBSCRIPTIONS` (Suppress server boost notifications)
* `SUPPRESS_GUILD_REMINDER_NOTIFICATIONS` (Suppress server setup tips)

methods.name: any
methods.description: Checks whether the bitfield has a bit, or any of multiple bits.

methods.name: equals
methods.description: Checks if this bitfield equals another

methods.name: has
methods.description: Checks whether the bitfield has a bit, or multiple bits.

methods.name: missing
methods.description: Gets all given bits that are missing from the bitfield.

params.name: hasParams
params.description: Additional parameters for the has method, if any

methods.name: freeze
methods.description: Freezes these bits, making them immutable.

returns.description: These bits

methods.name: add
methods.description: Adds bits to these ones.

returns.description: These bits or new BitField if the instance is frozen.

methods.name: remove
methods.description: Removes bits from these.

returns.description: These bits or new BitField if the instance is frozen.

methods.name: serialize
methods.description:
Gets an object mapping field names to a {@link boolean} indicating whether the
bit is available.

params.name: hasParams
params.description: Additional parameters for the has method, if any

methods.name: toArray
methods.description: Gets an {@link Array} of bitfield names based on the bits available.

params.name: hasParams
params.description: Additional parameters for the has method, if any

classes.name: Util
classes.description: Contains various general-purpose utility methods.

methods.name: flatten
methods.description: Flatten an object. Any properties that are collections will get converted to an array of keys.

methods.name: splitMessage
methods.description: Splits a string into multiple chunks at a designated character that do not exceed a specific length.

params.name: options
params.description: Options controlling the behavior of the split

methods.name: escapeMarkdown
methods.description: Escapes any Discord-flavour markdown in a string.

methods.name: escapeCodeBlock
methods.description: Escapes code block markdown in a string.

methods.name: escapeInlineCode
methods.description: Escapes inline code markdown in a string.

methods.name: escapeItalic
methods.description: Escapes italic markdown in a string.

methods.name: escapeBold
methods.description: Escapes bold markdown in a string.

methods.name: escapeUnderline
methods.description: Escapes underline markdown in a string.

methods.name: escapeStrikethrough
methods.description: Escapes strikethrough markdown in a string.

methods.name: escapeSpoiler
methods.description: Escapes spoiler markdown in a string.

methods.name: fetchRecommendedShards
methods.description: Gets the recommended shard count from Discord.

returns.description: The recommended number of shards

methods.name: parseEmoji
methods.description:
Parses emoji info out of a string. The string must be one of:
* A UTF-8 emoji (no ID)
* A URL-encoded UTF-8 emoji (no ID)
* A Discord custom emoji (`<:name:id>` or `<a:name:id>`)

returns.description: Object with `animated`, `name`, and `id` properties

methods.description: Resolves a partial emoji object from an {@link EmojiIdentifierResolvable}, without checking a Client.

methods.name: cloneObject
methods.description: Shallow-copies an object with its class/prototype intact.

methods.name: mergeDefault
methods.description: Sets default properties on an object that aren't already specified.

methods.name: makeError
methods.description: Makes an Error from a plain info object.

methods.name: makePlainError
methods.description: Makes a plain error info object from an Error.

methods.name: moveElementInArray
methods.description: Moves an element in an array *in place*.

params.name: newIndex
params.description: Index or offset to move the element to

params.name: offset
params.description: Move the element by an offset amount rather than to a set index

methods.name: verifyString
methods.description: Verifies the provided data is a string, otherwise throws provided error.

params.name: error
params.description: The Error constructor to instantiate. Defaults to Error

params.name: errorMessage
params.description: The error message to throw with. Defaults to "Expected string, got <data> instead."

params.name: allowEmpty
params.description: Whether an empty string should be allowed

methods.name: resolveColor
methods.description: Resolves a ColorResolvable into a color number.

returns.description: A color

methods.name: discordSort
methods.description: Sorts by Discord's position and ID.

methods.name: setPosition

params.name: item
params.description: Object to set the position of

params.name: relative
params.description: Whether `position` is relative to its current position

params.name: sorted
params.description: A collection of the objects sorted properly

returns.description: Updated item list, with `id` and `position` properties

methods.name: basename
methods.description: Alternative to Node's `path.basename`, removing query string after the extension if it exists.

params.name: path
params.description: Path to get the basename of

returns.description: Basename of the path

methods.description: Transforms a snowflake from a decimal string to a bit string.

methods.description: Transforms a snowflake from a bit string to a decimal string.

methods.name: removeMentions
methods.description: Breaks user, role and everyone/here mentions by adding a zero width space after every @ character

params.description: The channel the string was sent in

methods.name: cleanCodeBlockContent
methods.description: The content to put in a codeblock with all codeblock fences replaced by the equivalent backticks.

methods.name: delayFor

params.name: ms
params.description: How long to wait before resolving (in milliseconds)

interfaces.name: InteractionResponses
interfaces.description: Interface for classes that support shared interaction response types.

methods.name: defer
methods.description: Defers the reply to this interaction.
examples:
// Defer the reply to this interaction
interaction.defer()
  .then(console.log)
  .catch(console.error)

params.name: options
params.description: Options for deferring the reply to this interaction

methods.name: reply
methods.description: Creates a reply to this interaction.

methods.name: fetchReply
methods.description: Fetches the initial reply to this interaction.

methods.name: editReply
methods.description: Edits the initial reply to this interaction.

params.name: options
params.description: The new options for the message

methods.name: deleteReply
methods.description: Deletes the initial reply to this interaction.

methods.name: followUp
methods.description: Send a follow-up message to this interaction.

methods.name: deferUpdate
methods.description: Defers an update to the message to which the component was attached.

params.name: options
params.description: Options for deferring the update to this interaction

methods.name: update
methods.description: Updates the original message whose button was pressed.

interfaces.name: TextBasedChannel
interfaces.description: Interface for classes that have text-channel-like features.

props.name: messages
props.description: A manager of the messages sent to this channel

props.name: lastMessageID
props.description: The ID of the last message in the channel, if one was sent

props.name: lastPinTimestamp
props.description: The timestamp when the last pinned message was pinned, if there was one

props.name: lastMessage
props.description: The Message object of the last message in the channel, if one was sent

props.name: lastPinAt
props.description: The date when the last pinned message was pinned, if there was one

props.name: typing
props.description: Whether or not the typing indicator is being shown in the channel

props.name: typingCount
props.description: Number of times `startTyping` has been called

methods.name: send
methods.description: Sends a message to this channel.

methods.name: startTyping
methods.description: Starts a typing indicator in the channel.
examples:
// Start typing in a channel, or increase the typing count by one
channel.startTyping();

// Start typing in a channel with a typing count of five, or set it to five
channel.startTyping(5);

params.name: count
params.description: The number of times startTyping should be considered to have been called

returns.description: Resolves once the bot stops typing gracefully, or rejects when an error occurs

methods.name: stopTyping
methods.description:
Stops the typing indicator in the channel.
The indicator will only stop if this is called as many times as startTyping().
<info>It can take a few seconds for the client user to stop typing.</info>
examples:
// Reduce the typing count by one and stop typing if it reached 0
channel.stopTyping();

// Force typing to fully stop regardless of typing count
channel.stopTyping(true);

params.name: force
params.description: Whether or not to reset the call count and force the indicator to stop

methods.name: createMessageCollector
methods.description: Creates a Message Collector.

params.name: options
params.description: The options to pass to the collector

methods.name: awaitMessages
methods.description:
Similar to createMessageCollector but in promise form.
Resolves with a collection of messages that pass the specified filter.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional options to pass to the internal collector

methods.name: createMessageComponentInteractionCollector
methods.description: Creates a button interaction collector.

params.name: options
params.description: Options to send to the collector

methods.name: awaitMessageComponentInteraction
methods.description:
Collects a single component interaction that passes the filter.
The Promise will reject if the time expires.

params.name: options
params.description: Options to pass to the internal collector

methods.name: bulkDelete
methods.description: Bulk deletes given messages that are newer than two weeks.

params.name: messages
params.description: Messages or number of messages to delete

params.name: filterOld
params.description: Filter messages to remove those which are older than two weeks automatically

returns.description: Deleted messages

typedefs.name: ApplicationCommandResolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that resolves to give an ApplicationCommand object. This can be:
* An ApplicationCommand object
* A Snowflake

typedefs.name: BaseFetchOptions
typedefs.description: Options used to fetch data from discord

props.name: cache
props.description: Whether to cache the fetched data if it wasn't already

props.name: force
props.description: Whether to skip the cache check and request the API

typedefs.name: FetchApplicationCommandOptions
typedefs.description: Options used to fetch Application Commands from discord

props.name: guildID
props.description: ID of the guild to fetch commands for, for when the guild is not cached

typedefs.name: ApplicationCommandPermissionData
typedefs.description: Data for setting the permissions of an application command.

props.name: id
props.description: The ID of the role or user

props.name: type
props.description: Whether this permission is for a role or a user

props.name: permission
props.description: Whether the role or user has the permission to use this command

typedefs.name: ApplicationCommandPermissions
typedefs.description: The object returned when fetching permissions for an application command.

props.name: id
props.description: The ID of the role or user

props.name: type
props.description: Whether this permission is for a role or a user

props.name: permission
props.description: Whether the role or user has the permission to use this command

typedefs.name: BaseApplicationCommandPermissionsOptions
typedefs.description:
Options for managing permissions for one or more Application Commands
<warn>When passing these options to a manager where `guildID` is `null`,
`guild` is a required parameter</warn>

params.name: guild
params.description:
The guild to modify / check permissions for
<warn>Ignored when the manager has a non-null `guildID` property</warn>

params.name: command
params.description:
The command to modify / check permissions for
<warn>Ignored when the manager has a non-null `commandID` property</warn>

typedefs.name: GuildApplicationCommandPermissionData
typedefs.description: Data used for overwriting the permissions for all application commands in a guild.

props.name: id
props.description: The ID of the command

props.name: permissions
props.description: The permissions for this command

typedefs.name: SetApplicationCommandPermissionsOptions
typedefs.description:
Options used to set permissions for one or more Application Commands in a guild
<warn>One of `command` AND `permissions`, OR `fullPermissions` is required.
`fullPermissions` is not a valid option when passing to a manager where `commandID` is non-null</warn>

params.name: permissions
params.description: The new permissions for the command

params.name: fullPermissions
params.description:
The new permissions for all commands
in a guild <warn>When this parameter is set, permissions and command are ignored</warn>

typedefs.name: AddApplicationCommandPermissionsOptions
typedefs.description:
Options used to add permissions to a command
<warn>The `command` parameter is not optional when the managers `commandID` is `null`</warn>

params.name: permissions
params.description: The permissions to add to the command

typedefs.name: RemoveApplicationCommandPermissionsOptions
typedefs.description:
Options used to remove permissions from a command
<warn>The `command` parameter is not optional when the managers `commandID` is `null`</warn>

params.name: users
params.description:
The user(s) to remove from the command permissions
<warn>One of `users` or `roles` is required</warn>

params.name: roles
params.description:
The role(s) to remove from the command permissions
<warn>One of `users` or `roles` is required</warn>

typedefs.name: HasApplicationCommandPermissionsOptions
typedefs.description:
Options used to check existance of permissions on a command
<warn>The `command` parameter is not optional when the managers `commandID` is `null`</warn>

params.name: permissionID
params.description:
The user or role to check if a permission exists for
on this command.

props.name: shards
props.description:
ID of the shard to run, or an array of shard IDs. If not specified,
the client will spawn {@link ClientOptions#shardCount} shards. If set to `auto`, it will fetch the
recommended amount of shards from Discord and spawn that amount

props.description:
The total amount of shards used by all processes of this bot
(e.g. recommended shard count, shard count of the ShardingManager)

props.name: messageCacheMaxSize
props.description:
Maximum number of messages to cache per channel
(-1 or Infinity for unlimited - don't do this without message sweeping, otherwise memory usage will climb
indefinitely)

props.name: messageCacheLifetime
props.description:
How long a message should stay in the cache until it is considered
sweepable (in seconds, 0 for forever)

props.name: messageSweepInterval
props.description:
How frequently to remove messages from the cache that are older than
the message cache lifetime (in seconds, 0 for never)

props.name: allowedMentions
props.description: Default value for {@link MessageOptions#allowedMentions}

props.name: invalidRequestWarningInterval
props.description:
The number of invalid REST requests (those that return
401, 403, or 429) in a 10 minute window between emitted warnings (0 for no warnings). That is, if set to 500,
warnings will be emitted at invalid request number 500, 1000, 1500, and so on.

props.name: partials
props.description:
Structures allowed to be partial. This means events can be emitted even when
they're missing all the data for a particular structure. See the "Partial Structures" topic on the
[guide](https://discordjs.guide/popular-topics/partials.html) for some
important usage information, as partials require you to put checks in place when handling data.

props.name: restWsBridgeTimeout
props.description:
Maximum time permitted between REST responses and their

props.name: restTimeOffset
props.description:
Extra time in milliseconds to wait before continuing to make REST
requests (higher values will reduce rate-limiting errors on bad connections)

props.name: restRequestTimeout
props.description: Time to wait before cancelling a REST request, in milliseconds

props.name: restSweepInterval
props.description:
How frequently to delete inactive request buckets, in seconds
(or 0 for never)

props.name: restGlobalRateLimit
props.description:
How many requests to allow sending per second (0 for unlimited, 50 for
the standard global limit used by Discord)

props.name: rejectOnRateLimit
props.description:
Decides how rate limits and pre-emptive throttles
should be handled. If this option is an array containing the prefix of the request route (e.g. /channels to match any
route starting with /channels, such as /channels/222197033908436994/messages) or a function returning true, a
{@link RateLimitError} will be thrown. Otherwise the request will be queued for later

props.name: retryLimit
props.description: How many times to retry on 5XX errors (Infinity for indefinite amount of retries)

typedefs.name: InviteScope
typedefs.description:
A valid scope to request when generating an invite link.
<warn>Scopes that require whitelist are not considered valid for this generator</warn>
* `applications.builds.read`: allows reading build data for a users applications
* `applications.commands`: allows this bot to create commands in the server
* `applications.entitlements`: allows reading entitlements for a users applications
* `applications.store.update`: allows reading and updating of store data for a users applications
* `connections`: makes the endpoint for getting a users connections available
* `email`: allows the `/users/@me` endpoint return with an email
* `identify`: allows the `/users/@me` endpoint without an email
* `guilds`: makes the `/users/@me/guilds` endpoint available for a user
* `guilds.join`: allows the bot to join the user to any guild it is in using Guild#addMember
* `gdm.join`: allows joining the user to a group dm
* `webhook.incoming`: generates a webhook to a channel

typedefs.name: InviteResolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that can be resolved to give an invite code. This can be:
* An invite code
* An invite URL

typedefs.name: GuildTemplateResolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that can be resolved to give an template code. This can be:
* A template code
* A template URL

typedefs.name: Base64Resolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that resolves to give a Base64 string, typically for image uploading. This can be:
* A Buffer
* A base64 string

typedefs.name: BufferResolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that can be resolved to give a Buffer. This can be:
* A Buffer
* The path to a local file
* A URL

typedefs.name: IntentsResolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that can be resolved to give a permission number. This can be:
* A string (see {@link Intents.FLAGS})
* An intents flag
* An instance of Intents
* An array of IntentsResolvable

typedefs.name: PermissionResolvable
typedefs.description:
Data that can be resolved to give a permission number. This can be:
* A string (see {@link Permissions.FLAGS})
* A permission number
* An instance of Permissions
* An Array of PermissionResolvable

typedefs.name: Snowflake
typedefs.description:
A Twitter snowflake, except the epoch is 2015-01-01T00:00:00.000Z
```
If we have a snowflake '266241948824764416' we can represent it as binary:

64                                          22     17     12          0
 000000111011000111100001101001000101000000  00001  00000  000000000000
      number of ms since Discord epoch       worker  pid    increment
```

typedefs.name: DeconstructedSnowflake
typedefs.description: A deconstructed snowflake.

props.name: timestamp
props.description: Timestamp the snowflake was created

props.name: date
props.description: Date the snowflake was created

props.name: workerID
props.description: Worker ID in the snowflake

props.name: processID
props.description: Process ID in the snowflake

props.name: increment
props.description: Increment in the snowflake

props.name: binary
props.description: Binary representation of the snowflake

typedefs.name: SplitOptions
typedefs.description: Options for splitting a message.

props.name: maxLength
props.description: Maximum character length per message piece

props.name: char
props.description:
Character(s) or Regex(s) to split the message with,
an array can be used to split multiple times

props.name: prepend
props.description: Text to prepend to every piece except the first

props.name: append
props.description: Text to append to every piece except the last

typedefs.name: EscapeMarkdownOptions
typedefs.description: Options used to escape markdown.

props.name: codeBlock
props.description: Whether to escape code blocks or not

props.name: inlineCode
props.description: Whether to escape inline code or not

props.name: bold
props.description: Whether to escape bolds or not

props.name: italic
props.description: Whether to escape italics or not

props.name: underline
props.description: Whether to escape underlines or not

props.name: strikethrough
props.description: Whether to escape strikethroughs or not

props.name: spoiler
props.description: Whether to escape spoilers or not

props.name: codeBlockContent
props.description: Whether to escape text inside code blocks or not

props.name: inlineCodeContent
props.description: Whether to escape text inside inline code or not

typedefs.name: MakeErrorOptions
typedefs.description: Options used to make an error object.

props.name: name
props.description: Error type

props.name: message
props.description: Message for the error

props.name: stack
props.description: Stack for the error
